issue.title: [Python] TimestampScalar.as_py() and DurationScalar.as_py() docs inaccurately describe return types
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13897](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13897). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
If I'm reading the code correctly, Pandas data types are only used if units are nanoseconds. Also, TimestampScalar returns a Python datetime.datetime, not datetime.timedelta.
